intro: Lavatera pallida, commonly known as the pale lavatera, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Lavatera pallida is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in gardens.
